SENT.plain: We report a male autopsy case of Fukuyama-type congenital muscular dystrophy (FCMD), with unusual neuropathological findings
The patient was a Japanese man aged 26 years at the time of death
He had shown severe psychomotor retardation and muscular dystrophy since early infancy, and was diagnosed as having FCMD at the age of 5 years
The main neuropathological finding was extensive cerebral and cerebellar cortical dysplasia, characteristic of this disorder
In addition, degeneration of the cerebellar efferent pathway, including the dentate nucleus, superior cerebellar peduncle, and red nucleus, and that of the lateral thalamic nucleus were observed
These findings suggest the possibility that the long survival can clarify the latent neurodegeneration in the cerebellum and thalamus in FCMD, in addition to congenital malformations
The system degeneration should be carefully evaluated in the pathological examination of this disorder
